Body: I suppose German Zigeuner and Romanian ţigan (gypsy) share a common etymology from Greek τσιγγάνος. I wonder if Swedish tigga, which means to beg and looks/sounds quite similar to ţigan, has an etymological link. Maybe people historically associated begging with gypsies, so that the Swedish word for begging originated from the same source. Does it?
Title: Any etymological link between German/Romanian/Greek Zigeuner/țigan/τσιγγάνος and Scandinavian tigga?
